task.title: Migrate an Image from AWS to Eucalyptus
task.shortdesc: To migrate an image from AWS to Eucalyptus, perform the following steps.

info.codeblock: euca-describe-images --region aws IMAGE ami-a6e15bcf aws-marketplace/CentOS-6.3-x86_64-GA-ebs-85586466-5b6c-4495-b580-14f72b4bcf51-ami-3689325f.1 aws-marketplace available privatex86_64 machine aki-88aa75e1 ebs paravirtual xen BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING /dev/sda snap-831129f5 8 false

step.cmd: Run an instance from the image you chose.
SSH into the instance and verify that the instance is valid for use with Eucalyptus.

substep.cmd: Check /etc/fstab and remove any non-standard drives or partitions (input: block-device mapping) and any reference to Xen device names
Make sure that the acpiphp module is available
Make sure that udev net persistent
ensure special system directories are not populated (places like proc, sysfs, devpts, debugfs, udevfs, cgroup, tmpfs, etc., which should not have real files in them)
ensure that not more than one Ethernet device is configured

step.cmd: Mount a volume that is at least 1.5 times as large as the entire instance.
Bundle the running instance. For example:

info.codeblock: sudo -s ec2-bundle-vol -d /mnt -u 4299-4227-3585 -k scottb-euca-aws.pem -c scottb-euca-aws-cert.pem -r x86_64 -s 2048 Copying / into the image file /mnt/image... Excluding: /dev/pts / /sys /proc /proc/sys/fs/binfmt_misc /dev /media /mnt /proc /sys /mnt/image /mnt/img-mnt 1+0 records in 1+0 records out 1048576 bytes (1.0 MB) copied, 0.00209056 s, 502 MB/s mke2fs 1.42.3 (14-May-2012) Bundling image file... Splitting /mnt/image.tar.gz.enc... Created image.part.00 Created image.part.01 [example truncated] Created image.part.30 Generating digests for each part... Digests generated. Unable to read instance meta-data for ancestor-ami-ids Unable to read instance meta-data for ramdisk-id Unable to read instance meta-data for product-codes Creating bundle manifest... ec2-bundle-vol complete.

step.cmd: Switch the Euca2ools configuration file to use Eucalyptus
Upload the AWS bundled instance to Eucalyptus.
